sentences.english: All things being equal, fat people use more soap.
sentences.chinese: 所有事物平等，胖人用更多的香皂。

sentences.english: Mock speculates that car interiors might not be suitably designed for heavy people.
sentences.chinese: 莫克推测，汽车的内部设计或许不适合于胖人。

sentences.english: Another special chronicled the life of the fattest man in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这是另一个世界上最胖人生活的长篇记录。

sentences.english: That chair won't support a heavy person.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子经不住一个胖人。

sentences.english: In hot summer weather, on the other hand, fat people may feel unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，炎热的夏季会令胖人感到不快。

sentences.english: The overweighted people's toleration is bad in summer.
sentences.chinese: 胖人在夏天的忍受力较差。

sentences.english: Nowadays many weight-watchers would like to go to the gym.
sentences.chinese: 现在有很多胖人喜好到健身房去磨炼。

sentences.english: Fat people are discriminated against, unfairly and pervasively .
sentences.chinese: 胖人受到歧视，待遇不公是普遍现象。

sentences.english: We do not necessarily respect a fat man more than a thin man.
sentences.chinese: 比起瘦人，我们并不见得更尊重胖人。

sentences.english: Did fat person get lipoma how to do?
sentences.chinese: 胖人得了脂肪瘤怎么办？

sentences.english: Obese people are more likely to take time off owing to illness.
He was running in the fat man’s race.
sentences.chinese: 他参加了胖人的赛跑比赛。

sentences.english: And nearly one out of three obese people were also metabolically fit.
sentences.chinese: 近三分之一的胖人代谢是正常的。

definition: to put on weight/to get fat
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive
fat (in the body, in a plant, or in food)
big-hearted and serene (idiom); contented and easy-going
to save food/to go on a diet
